main event: On March 15, 1950, three crew members of a TACA commercial airline reported seeing four disc-shaped unidentified flying objects (UFOs) over the Guatemala City Airport in Guatemala.
interesting points: The UFOs were estimated to be flying at an altitude of 25,000 feet and at a speed over 1,000 mph, possibly 1,200-1,500 mph.
The UFOs were described as dull silver in color, slightly elliptical in shape, and larger than a C-54 aircraft.
The UFOs performed a series of maneuvers, including flying north for about 30 miles, then turning 180 degrees and heading southwest, with additional objects following behind the first.
The UFOs made no noise and left no vapor trail, indicating they lacked any visible means of propulsion.
A photograph of the incident was reportedly published in a Guatemala City newspaper the following day, showing an object about the size of a penny.
witnesses: three crew members of a TACA commercial airline
photographs: yes, a photograph was reportedly published in a Guatemala City newspaper
